titleInfo.title: View No. 6. Missionary Ridge. Nineteenth Louisiana Infantry.

subject.topic: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)

mods.abstract: White board marks left of 19th Louisiana in the battle of November 25th, 1863, forming the left of Adams' Brigade of Stewart's Division. The position is to the left of those shown in Views Nos. 2, 3, 4 and 5 and is just below the crest of the ridge. The turnpike seen, is the one constructed on the crest of the ridge by the National Park Commission. The electric railroad runs on the slope below it. The view is looking south, with Chattanooga to the right.This position was fixed by the Louisiana and the National Commissioners on September 24th, 1894, and marked and noted by E. E. Betts, engineer of the National Commission.

titleInfo.title: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.) Louisiana Committee. Photographs
Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Photographs

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
